alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; North Laramie Range; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range; South Laramie Range; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 4:33PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong outflow winds from thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Carbon and central Albany Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 432 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles west of Shirley Basin to 7 miles southwest of Battle Mountain to 7 miles north of Arlington to near French Creek Campground. Movement was east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albany, Hanna, Encampment, Medicine Bow, Rock River, Elk Mountain, Battle Mountain, Grand Encampment, Bosler, Brooklyn Lake Campground, Nash Fork Campground, Ryan Park Campground, Rob Roy Reservoir, Lake Owen, Bobbie Thompson Campground, Arlington, French Creek Campground, Shirley Basin, Ryan Park and Brooklyn Lake. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 246 and 305. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
